result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defendant not produced due to quarantine status. Spanish interpreter waived due to defendant unable to appear.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests the cash bond on deposit be transferred to defendant's pending case 22CM1153. 
Court orders cash bail in 15CT826 to be transferred to case 22CM1153.
Court grants defendant and interpreter to appear by zoom for the next court hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Plummer requests an adjournment as he has not been able to communicate with his client.  Court authorizes the use of a Court Translator to help with filling out plea papers. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes not in court, in custody.  
Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for plea and sentencing  Atty. Plummer has not been able to meet with his client and requests an adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Plummer in court.  Defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes not in court, defendant in custody.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Plummer requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense advises the court he has discovery but not an offer and requests an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Br. 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with MH
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing.

Defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martin Ricardo Bernabe-Montes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling Conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Court dismissed 939.63(1)(b) "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer (incorrect for charge)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
